defination: Strong, healthy, and full of energy.
example: A tall, vigorous, and muscular man
synonyms: 'robust', 'healthy', 'in good health', 'hale and hearty', 'strong', 'strong as an horse', 'strong as an lion', 'strong as an ox', 'sturdy', 'fine', 'fit', 'in good condition', 'in tip-top condition', 'in good shape', 'in good trim', 'in good kilter'

defination: Form a mental image of; imagine.
example: It is not easy to visualize the future
synonyms: 'envisage', 'envision', 'conjure up', 'conjure up an image of', 'conjure up an picture of', "picture in the mind's eye", 'picture', 'call to mind', 'see', 'imagine', 'evoke', 'fancy', 'dream about', 'dream up', 'fantasize about', 'conceptualize', 'conceive of', 'think about', 'contemplate'

defination: Remove or take out, especially by effort or force.
example: The fossils are extracted from the chalk
synonyms: 'take out', 'draw out', 'bring out', 'pull out', 'remove', 'withdraw', 'pluck out', 'fish out', 'prize out', 'extricate'

defination: A Christian community under monastic vows, especially one of nuns.
example: Maria entered the convent at the age of eighteen

defination: The way in which a word is pronounced.

defination: Say or estimate that (a specified thing) will happen in the future or will be a consequence of something.
example: It is too early to predict a result

defination: The combined action of a group of people, especially when effective and efficient.
